query:
Store as Studio:
How retail stores are becoming content properties
title: Holiday Flagship Early-Access & Pop-up Tests
highlights: Unified holiday targets: footfall **10–15%** uplift; early-window share **20–30%**; event CPA ≤**0.80×**; QR redemption **≥5%** of footfall.
A/B framing: Arm A legacy markdown vs Arm B bundle+GWP+loyalty inside the same two-week window to isolate CPA and early-window share.
Use vacant-bay pop-up as a measurement lab to concentrate early-window transactions and prove per-sqft economics before cluster scale-up [^4][^1].
executive_summary: A two-week early-access holiday program paired with a pop-up lab and an Arm A vs Arm B A/B test (Arm A legacy markdown vs Arm B bundle+GWP+loyalty) concentrates attention and converts vacant retail bays into measurable commerce channels [^3][^4][^5]. Target the unified holiday pack: foot-traffic uplift **10–15%** (stretch **≥25%** in top markets), early-window transaction share **20–30%** (vs ~12–15% baseline), event CPA ≤**0.80×** baseline, and QR/scan redemption **≥5%** of footfall. In the next **30 days**, Real Estate, Retail Ops, Marketing, Commerce/Data, and Merchandising must lock pilot sites, instrument door counts and QR→POS flows, define A/B holdouts, tag event SKUs and wire dashboards to track early-window share and CPA [^1][^2][^7]. The operator move is straightforward: run the two-arm early-access in a converted bay, measure incremental footfall and CPA, then scale the winning arm into a cluster of stores [^4][^3].
top_operator_moves: Lock and convert **3** pilot sites; secure landlord approvals and a weekend activation calendar for one pop-up lab.
Deploy measurement stack in **30 days**: door counts or camera proxy, QR→POS linking, event-SKU flags, and an A/B holdout segment wired to dashboards.
Build Arm B offers: curated bundle + GWP + loyalty enrollment flow; run head-to-head vs Arm A markdown and measure CPA and early-window share.

issues: Quantifier returned fewer than two anchors
